materials.raw_text: Mn: 120 g, P: 70 g, Y: 10 g, Zr: 10 g, Binder (e.g., epoxy resin): 50 g, Hardener (for epoxy resin): 10 g, Filler (silica or alumina powder): 30 g

sourcing.instructions: Mn (Manganese powder): Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. P (Phosphorus powder): Specialty chemical suppliers or online. Y (Yttrium oxide): Rare earth material suppliers. Zr (Zirconium powder): Metal supply companies. Epoxy resin and hardener: Hardware stores or craft supply stores. Silica or alumina powder: Chemical supply stores or online.
steps: Mn (Manganese powder): Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. P (Phosphorus powder): Specialty chemical suppliers or online. Y (Yttrium oxide): Rare earth material suppliers. Zr (Zirconium powder): Metal supply companies. Epoxy resin and hardener: Hardware stores or craft supply stores. Silica or alumina powder: Chemical supply stores or online.

1. Measure each metal powder (Mn, P, Y, Zr) accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured metal powders. 3. Add the silica or alumina filler to the metal mixture. 4. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved. 5. In a separate container, prepare the epoxy resin according to the manufacturer's instructions. 6. Gradually add the hardener to the resin while stirring continuously. 7. Once the resin and hardener are mixed, slowly incorporate the metal powder blend into the resin mixture. Stir until evenly dispersed.

steps: After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, trim any excess material using a diamond saw. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces of the sample using progressively finer grits until a smooth finish is achieved. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation. Allow to cure as per the sealant instructions.
